file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
I felt his death. Darth Ikoral, one of the Empire's greatest heroes... now a relic laid low.
Was there any dignity in it?
Ikoral believed in his cause until the end. He was strong, in his way.
He fought well.
Huh. Perhaps.
Just know that it's over.
Of course.
He died like everyone dies--a failure, desperate for another breath.
Death is rarely dignified.
So like his own student.
Ikoral's greatest apprentice was my master--he died for his lack of vision as well, after he taught me what it meant to be Sith.
But the age of purity has been over for many years. You've proven that today.
If the Empire doesn't learn from its mistakes, it won't survive much longer.
Let's hope the lesson sticks.
We will make it survive.
The Force runs through my veins in ways it never will through yours. Do not forget that.
The pure are forever greater.
Yet true power still eludes you.
It wasn't purity that led to Ikoral's downfall. You said yourself it was blindness--but you're too certain of your own path.
Learn from Ikoral's arrogance.
As you are certain of yours.
Pure, impure... I don't care.
Then I hope I could accommodate you.
Until the next crisis. Malgus out.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
This is Vaiken Spacedock to Darth Malgus. Your strike team has arrived.
Then let us begin.
Perhaps you have heard of Darth Ikoral--a great man of pure Sith blood, decorated by the Emperor and honored for his might.
Ikoral lived like royalty a century ago, in a time when purebloods carried unparalleled prestige and the Empire remained hidden.
I'm not familiar with him. What did this "Ikoral" accomplish?
Who was he?
In my experience, the red skin of a pureblood counts as much now as ever.
Sith still value purebloods.
The old ways may linger, but they are passing.
I know about the red skin, but the history eludes me.
Tell me about Sith purebloods.
The Sith species interbred with fallen Jedi long ago--that ancestry marks a pureblood.
He lived in a time without war in a society that revered him. It must have been difficult.
So he was a pampered fool.
The Empire may have been hidden from the Republic, but there were still enemies to conquer.
They say the pureblooded Sith left behind were wiped out when we left for Dromund Kaas and rebuilt our Empire a millennium past.
But Ikoral believed purebloods survived outside the Empire, reduced to barbarism on forgotten worlds. Seventy years ago, Ikoral left in search of these lost Sith and never returned.
Now Ikoral is back from his seventy-year journey. Why isn't that good news?
I take it he's reappeared.
These purebloods Ikoral was after... did they even exist?
Tell me about these lost Sith.
There was no way to be certain--but without the guidance of the Emperor, they would surely have degenerated and forgotten us.
Enough of the history.
Three days ago, we received this message from Lord Senu at his fortress on the edge of known space.
...it was an Imperial ship, of outdated design. It jumped in-system and began firing.
Then the landing parties came. Purebloods dressed like savages, butchering my men... they're coming for me now--
That creature was not Sith. And an Empire that calls such creatures "lord" is not a Sith Empire.
For decades, men spoke of Darth Ikoral as a martyr. Now he has returned with a pureblood army, determined to murder the aliens now "polluting" the Empire.
So he must be executed before he strikes again--or wins followers.
You want Darth Ikoral dead.
Yes.
Ikoral may believe in pureblood superiority, but how does wiping out aliens serve his cause?
Why kill aliens?
There was a time when only humans and purebloods could become Sith. Ikoral sees the new ways as heresy.
The Empire has become impure. Darth Ikoral may be the reminder we need.
Maybe I agree with him.
There are many Imperials, Sith and otherwise, who would support him.
He's not alone in his opinion.
Even the Dark Council recognizes that now is not the time for infighting or a return to old ways!
Darth Ikoral strikes at both Republic and Imperial targets; we have a location on his dreadnaught, but it will not last.
He must be destroyed before this vendetta causes irreparable damage. Only you are capable.
The apprentice slays the master. The new Sith surpass their predecessors. It will be done.
The new must destroy the old.
By day's end, Ikoral will understand that he is an artifact of history... and that the Sith Order is more powerful than ever.
The new replaces the old.
Very well.
Ikoral's a hundred-year-old Sith Lord with an army of followers. I'd appreciate any tactical advice you can offer.
What can I expect?
I know little about his followers, but Ikoral will not expect an Intelligence officer to pose a threat--that is your advantage.
I've killed gangsters and Jedi Masters. A hundred-year-old Sith Lord won't be any different.
Just another contract.
Darth Ikoral may be stubborn, but he's not the enemy. I might be able to talk him down.
I'd like to try to negotiate.
His Empire no longer exists, and he is frightened of what he sees--but if you can speak to him, do so.
Ikoral will be a corpse.
You have the coordinates of Ikoral's ship, the Red Reaper. Do this for the Empire.
[Start Veteran Mode]
[This holoterminal is offline.]
[Start Master Mode]
